title: How I made £1m: 'I had to close dad's business for my retro clothing shop to survive'
text:
This Telegraph Money series looks at how ordinary people made their fortune and how others can follow in their footsteps. It will be published on Mondays at 6am. You can read last week's article here.

Business owners, no matter how big or small, must make hard choices on a regular basis. But there can be few bigger decisions than whether to close a decades-old family business.

David Sedman’s family had sold clothing from market stalls in their native Yorkshire since the Sixties and he took full control when his father retired in 1998. But by 2016, Mr Sedman had reached a crossroads in both his professional and private life.
